unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify, describe and evaluate some aspects of Japanese-speaking cultures and societies.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of Japanese at elementary level.
Demonstrate an awareness of some language and language use, in both Japanese and in English.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.
Develop comprehensive elementary level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Japanese language.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and Japanese practice. Students should be familiar with the content of a week before attending their second seminar, and feel comfortable with each week’s content before starting a new week.

enrolment_rules.description: JPS101 or JPNS1010, or HSC Japanese Beginners Band 4 and above
Not to count for credit for students who completed HSC Japanese Continuers or HSC Japanese Extension, HSC Japanese in Context, HSC Japanese Literature

assessments.description: The mid-semester test will comprehensively test students on their reading, writing, and listening skills, covering the content of Weeks 1-7. Test is held online for all students.
This task requires students to create, perform, and record a video in Japanese in relation to a specific prompt. All students upload the final video to iLearn.
Students will complete the workbook for each week, check their answers against a model, and then submit the corrected file via iLearn.

Students will be required to participate in a Japanese conversation over a short time period, and answer any questions that arise during the conversation. This will occur as part of regularly scheduled class time for internal students, and via Zoom sessions for external students.
The final test will comprehensively evaluate students’ Japanese reading, listening, and writing skills, covering the entire content of the course. It is held online for all students.

Weekly activities to check and confirm active engagement with course material. This will occur as part of regularly scheduled class time for internal students, and as online activities for external students.
Students complete weekly online quizzes via iLearn, which test them on the content of the week.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Fully online/virtual
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit will improve students' understanding of Japanese grammar, vocabulary, culture, and writing so that they can accomplish a variety of practical and authentic tasks. Students will develop their listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills to a level where they can carry out a wide variety of common social interactions, and participate effectively in multiple communicative contexts. Additionally, students will gain basic proficiency in the use of the kanji script, and the ways that standard written Japanese employs kanji, hiragana, and katakana in tandem. The class provides opportunities for interactive language learning, and a wide variety of methods for Japanese practice through the use of online resources.
data.title: I Japanese Studies 2
